modName: Heart of Thunder Asgard Edition - Thor Armour and Mjolnir
summary: Doing away with all that lore-friendliness and immersion business, Heart of Thunder: Asgard Edition brings you Thor's armour and Mjölnir.
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=#ff0000][size=5][b]***This mod is now obsolete and I will no longer be supporting this version.***[/b][/size][/color]

[size=6]Please check out [color=#f1c232][b]Heart of Thunder: Ragnarok Edition[/b][/color].
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/90027]Legendary[/url]﻿ and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/15773]Special Edition[/url]﻿ versions.[/size]




[size="7"][b]- Whomsoever holds this hammer, if he be worthy, shall possess the power of Thor! -[/b][/size][/center]

[center][img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/25709-1-1350659734.jpg[/img][/center]

[b]Description
===========[/b]
Doing away with all that lore-friendliness and immersion business, Heart of Thunder: Asgard Edition brings you Thor's armour and Mjölnir.

This mod is largely identical to my previous Heart of Thunder mod but with the weapons and armour renamed.

[b]Acquiring the armour
====================[/b]
Here are step-by-step instructions on how to get the items ingame. A lot of the issues people have had stem from simply not reading the instructions. So to remedy this I've laid it out as clearly as I can.

- Head up the 7000 Steps toward High Hrothgar. About two thirds of the way up you will come across a large alcove (there's usually a troll standing on top of it - see reference pic in image section).

- In that alcove is a chest. Open it and you'll find a book called 'If He Be Worthy'.

- Read it and you will be granted the Heart of Thunder perk and two spells; Wrath of the Thunderer and Thor's Fury.
[b]NOTE[/b]: You must read the book from either your inventory or the world (i.e. dropping it and reading it from the ground). Reading from the chest inventory will not grant you the perk or spells.

- Also in the chest are Aetherium ingots and void salts. Take them and head to Whiterun.

- Once in Whiterun, head to the [i][b]Skyforge[/b][/i] as the items can only be crafted there. In addition to having the Heart of Thunder perk, you must also have a skill of [i][b]at least 50 in Smithing[/b][/i] in order to craft the items.

- The items can be found under the 'MISC' category. However should you have Dawnguard installed, they can be found under the 'Aetherium' category.

- By this time you will have noticed that you do not have enough Aetherium ingots to craft or temper the full set. No problem. Just head to the nearest smelter with some Void Salts, Iron ore, Corundum ore and Ectoplasm and you can smelt more.

- Happy smiting!

The armour cuirass has two variants; Heavy and sleeveless Light. Mjölnir also comes in an unenchanted version as well.

[center][youtube]lCAowlWxofE[/youtube][/center]

[b]Install
=======[/b]
Extract into your Skyrim install directory, or alternatively use the Download with Manager button and let NMM do it for you.

[b]Uninstall
=========[/b]
Delete all files pertaining to this mod, or if you used Nexus Mod Manager, let NMM do it.


[b]Incompatibility
===============[/b]
Currently incompatible with SkyRe.

[NOTE] As I do not personally use SkyRe, this mod wasn't made with compatability in mind.
If anyone wishes to make a compatability patch for SkyRe and upload it to the Nexus, you are most welcome to. If so, please inform me so that I can add it to this page.

It is not reccommended to to use this alongside the original Lore Friendly Heart of Thunder due to conflicts.

[b]Known Issues or Bugs
====================[/b]
The book script works when reading from either the player inventory or the world. For whatever reason it won't run when reading from the chest inventory.

Sometimes the book may not grant you the perk and or the crafted armour is invisible. To remedy this simply download the [b]loose files version[/b] from the file section

[b]History
=======[/b]

1.2 - Fixed erroneous operator reference in hammer recipies preventing them from showing up in the crafting menu if the player had 50 or greater in smithing.

1.1 - Fixed tempering recipies. Added outfits so you are able to benefit from certain armour perks.

1.0 - Initial release.
